Key Arguments: The bill is an overreach of authority and a threat to democracy by restricting free speech.
Determining misinformation is subjective and should not be controlled by the government.
Existing laws already address incitement to violence, which is the only direct harm caused by misinformation.
Past instances show that what was labeled as misinformation was later proven true, such as the effectiveness of Ivermectin for COVID-19.
Government and health authorities have themselves spread misinformation during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The bill exempts government and mainstream media, which are not trustworthy sources.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech and expression are fundamental rights in a democracy.
Who gets to determine what is misinformation or disinformation and what is the truth?
In a democracy it is not the role of government to stifle free speech, irrespective if anyone is offended.
